content.raw:
I created a little test package with a simple box with an IMU sensor attached to check how the accelerations of the box look. Both the internal Gazebo `ImuSensor` as well as the `gazebo_ros_imu` give very spiky outputs. While playing around with the ODE parameters I got the accelerations down to almost 0 when I set the SOR to somewhere close to 1 or below it. For the robots, with joints I had to additionally set the CFM parameter to a small non-zero value to get to acceptable values.

I am attaching my test package which outputs both ros and gazebo messages and has three test robots, one is only a box the second one has an additional imu link with a fixed joint and the third one has on top of that three wheels connected through revolute joints.
